info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 25 at 11:56PM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Logan, northern Christian, eastern Sangamon and southwestern Macon Counties through 1230 AM CDT... At 1156 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Rochester, or near Springfield, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Rochester around 1200 AM CDT. Edinburg around 1210 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Mechanicsburg, Illiopolis and Mount Auburn. This includes the following highways... Interstate 55 between mile markers 93 and 96. Interstate 72 between mile markers 99 and 102, and between mile markers 110 and 124. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for central Illinois.
